intro: Syngonanthus pulvinellus, commonly known as the small pulvinate sedge, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
